evidence.text: The Plaintiffs in this lawsuit are indigent Virginia residents who have suffered indefinite suspension of their driver’s licenses for failure to pay court costs and fines that they could not afford.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs are indigent Virginia residents who have suffered indefinite suspension of their driver’s licenses for failure to pay court costs and fines that they could not afford.

evidence.text: The DMV employee follows data entry protocols to issue the order of suspension.

extracted.value: The DMV automatically suspends licenses upon default without inquiry into financial circumstances.

evidence.text: The DMV does not require a judge or clerk to issue or enter an order of license suspension for failure to pay court costs or fines in order to effectuate the suspension.

evidence.text: The court transmits a person’s record of nonpayment to the DMV electronically via the Court Automated Interface System (CAIS) or manually via an amended abstract of conviction.
